_header: Beauty of you burn in my body abides
Note:
Ringler Jr. (1992)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse in Manuscript 1501-1558. London: Mansell, 1992; prepared and completed by Michael Rudick and Susan J. Ringler , TM 245.
Subjects: acrostics; love lyrics; women, as speakers/narrators
_description: Humfrey Newton, On her (or his?) lover, an acrostic on BRIAN — one stanza rhyme royal

BodLatMisC66.First Lines:
Beaute of you burne in my body abydisright reufully I sike yef I be
                    fer you fro…
BodLatMisC66.Last Lines:
…My body I wold be take in to youre gentillnesWith hert intier
                    & sperete of mekenes
BodLatMisC66.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “The Poems of Humphrey Newton, Esquire, 1466-1536.” 
             PMLA
         65 (1950): 249-81: 267.
Barratt,  Alexandra,
                        ed.  
             Women’s Writing in Middle English.
         London: Longman, 1992: 281-3.
